item.title: Biography
item.description: Ramya Thiyagarajan is a composer, vocalist, and ethnomusicologist whose work explores the intersections of experimental sound, Indian classical traditions, and contemporary narrative forms. Originally trained as an engineer, she transitioned into music after discovering a deep pull toward composition and voice—eventually studying at KM Music Conservatory in Chennai and earning an MA in Music Composition and Ethnomusicology from Hunter College, New York City. She is also a trained Carnatic classical vocalist.
